solution.text:
Irregularities between two surfaces lock into one another.
When we attempt to move any surface, we have to apply a force to overcome interlocking.
On rough surfaces, there are a large number of irregularities.
Therefore, the force of friction is greater.

content.text: The force of friction is greater when a rough surface is involved because _____ .

incorrect.text: the interlocking between the two surfaces is minimal

correct.text: there are a larger number of irregularities
